availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lydia Warnock. Father of Elizabeth A. Warnock, Rebecca Warnock, James F. Warnock, Mary Warnock, Margarett Warnock, John W. Warnock, Basil Warnock, Charles W. Warnock, America C. Warnock, and Matthew S. Warnock. Farmer in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Greenup County in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Elizabeth Clifton as a domestic servant in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 258B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 249.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 741.
Find A Grave, "Matthew Warnock (1807-1863)," Memorial #188350066, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/188350066 (accessed April 23, 2020).
